Accept PR range and tenant number as flags (#122)

This PR adds three flags to `package-builder dev`:

- `--pr_start`: the number of the cloud PR to start generating packages at (required)
- `--pr_end`: the number of the cloud PR to stop generating packages at (required)
- `--number_of_tenants`: the number of tenants to generate packages for (default: 3)

Shard root directory by hostname (#86)

For example, consider the files installed by a package:

```
$ ./tools/packaging/extract_mac_pkg.sh ./launcher.pkg
/var/folders/wp/6fkmvjf11gv18tdprv4g2mk40000gn/T/tmp.CmMvBfws/package
/var/folders/wp/6fkmvjf11gv18tdprv4g2mk40000gn/T/tmp.CmMvBfws/package/etc
/var/folders/wp/6fkmvjf11gv18tdprv4g2mk40000gn/T/tmp.CmMvBfws/package/etc/kolide
/var/folders/wp/6fkmvjf11gv18tdprv4g2mk40000gn/T/tmp.CmMvBfws/package/etc/kolide/secret
/var/folders/wp/6fkmvjf11gv18tdprv4g2mk40000gn/T/tmp.CmMvBfws/package/Library
/var/folders/wp/6fkmvjf11gv18tdprv4g2mk40000gn/T/tmp.CmMvBfws/package/Library/LaunchDaemons
/var/folders/wp/6fkmvjf11gv18tdprv4g2mk40000gn/T/tmp.CmMvBfws/package/Library/LaunchDaemons/com.kolide.launcher.plist
/var/folders/wp/6fkmvjf11gv18tdprv4g2mk40000gn/T/tmp.CmMvBfws/package/usr
/var/folders/wp/6fkmvjf11gv18tdprv4g2mk40000gn/T/tmp.CmMvBfws/package/usr/local
/var/folders/wp/6fkmvjf11gv18tdprv4g2mk40000gn/T/tmp.CmMvBfws/package/usr/local/kolide
/var/folders/wp/6fkmvjf11gv18tdprv4g2mk40000gn/T/tmp.CmMvBfws/package/usr/local/kolide/bin
/var/folders/wp/6fkmvjf11gv18tdprv4g2mk40000gn/T/tmp.CmMvBfws/package/usr/local/kolide/bin/launcher
/var/folders/wp/6fkmvjf11gv18tdprv4g2mk40000gn/T/tmp.CmMvBfws/package/usr/local/kolide/bin/osquery-extension.ext
/var/folders/wp/6fkmvjf11gv18tdprv4g2mk40000gn/T/tmp.CmMvBfws/package/usr/local/kolide/bin/osqueryd
/var/folders/wp/6fkmvjf11gv18tdprv4g2mk40000gn/T/tmp.CmMvBfws/package/var
/var/folders/wp/6fkmvjf11gv18tdprv4g2mk40000gn/T/tmp.CmMvBfws/package/var/kolide
/var/folders/wp/6fkmvjf11gv18tdprv4g2mk40000gn/T/tmp.CmMvBfws/package/var/kolide/localhost-5000
/var/folders/wp/6fkmvjf11gv18tdprv4g2mk40000gn/T/tmp.CmMvBfws/package/var/log
/var/folders/wp/6fkmvjf11gv18tdprv4g2mk40000gn/T/tmp.CmMvBfws/package/var/log/kolide
```

Notice that `/var/kolide/localhost-5000` is created by the package.

Now, consider the content of the LaunchDaemon

```xml
cat /var/folders/wp/6fkmvjf11gv18tdprv4g2mk40000gn/T/tmp.CmMvBfws/package/Library/LaunchDaemons/com.kolide.launcher.plist
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<!DOCTYPE plist PUBLIC "-//Apple//DTD PLIST 1.0//EN" "http://www.apple.com/DTDs/PropertyList-1.0.dtd">
<plist version="1.0">
    <dict>
        <key>Label</key>
        <string>com.kolide.launcher</string>
        <key>EnvironmentVariables</key>
        <dict>
            <key>KOLIDE_LAUNCHER_ROOT_DIRECTORY</key>
            <string>/var/kolide/localhost-5000</string>
            <key>KOLIDE_LAUNCHER_KOLIDE_URL</key>
            <string>localhost:8082</string>
            <key>KOLIDE_LAUNCHER_ENROLL_SECRET_PATH</key>
            <string>/etc/kolide/secret</string>
        </dict>
        <key>RunAtLoad</key>
        <true/>
        <key>KeepAlive</key>
        <true/>
        <key>ThrottleInterval</key>
        <integer>60</integer>
        <key>ProgramArguments</key>
        <array>
            <string>/usr/local/kolide/bin/launcher</string>
            <string>--insecure_grpc</string>
        </array>
        <key>StandardErrorPath</key>
        <string>/var/log/kolide/launcher-stderr.log</string>
        <key>StandardOutPath</key>
        <string>/var/log/kolide/launcher-stdout.log</string>
    </dict>
</plist>
```

Notice that `/var/kolide/localhost-5000` is used as the root directory.

After installing the package, note the content of `/var/kolide/localhost-5000`:

```
$ ls -l /var/kolide/localhost-5000
total 4112
-rw-------  1 root  wheel  2097152 Aug 22 10:54 launcher.db
-rw-r--r--  1 root  wheel       43 Aug 22 10:52 osquery.autoload
drwx------  8 root  wheel      272 Aug 22 10:53 osquery.db
-rw-r--r--  1 root  wheel        5 Aug 22 10:52 osquery.pid
srwxr-xr-x  1 root  wheel        0 Aug 22 10:52 osquery.sock
srwxr-xr-x  1 root  wheel        0 Aug 22 10:52 osquery.sock.52006
```

Improvements to clean_host.sh script (#83)

See the following command-line interface via the following interaction:

```
$ ./tools/packaging/clean_host.sh
This script must be run as root:
  sudo ./tools/packaging/clean_host.sh

$ sudo ./tools/packaging/clean_host.sh
Found 0 running launcher instance, but was expecting 1
Exiting...

$ sudo installer -pkg ~/Downloads/signed_production_launcher_package.pkg -target /
installer: Package name is signed_production_launcher_package
installer: Upgrading at base path /
installer: The upgrade was successful.

$ sudo ./tools/packaging/clean_host.sh
One launcher instance cleaned

$
```

Updated osquery-go version. Fixed log type mapping. (#74)

Bug Fixes

* Fix bug in logging handler panicked when it encountered an unknown log type.

Purge logs after writing to prevent unbounded growth of buffer (#70)

launcher: add tls config to grpc.Dial (#72)

Updates the launcher to dial the grpc server with a TLS config.

autoupdate: add autoupdate package (#34)

Adds the autoupdate package which wraps github.com/kolide/updater/tuf
to provide secure autoupdates from a remote mirror.
If enabled, both osquery and launcher itself are updated when
new versions are released.

use exported field in JWT claim (#64)

Fixes a bug introduced in #53. Since JWT uses reflection, all fields
in a claim must be exported.

Buffer osquery logs and send in batches (#62)

Osquery logs will be buffered in the BoltDB store, and only deleted when they
have been successfully sent to the server.

A forthcoming commit will add a limit on the total number of buffered logs.

README (#60)
Packaging Tooling (#53)

Generate UUID in launcher (#55)

On first run of the launcher, generate a new random UUID to send to the server
as the host identifier. If there is an existing UUID in the local store, use
that UUID.
Use cached configs when config retrieval fails (#49)

Add retry logic to opening osquery extension socket. (#54)

Lack of retries resulted in flaky tests, and would likely result in flaky real
world behavior. Tests should *very rarely* be flaky now, if at all.

As a side benefit, the tests now run slightly faster because we retry
every 500ms instead of waiting 2 seconds before trying once.

Fix synchronization issues causing failing tests. (#52)

- Update version of Thrift dependency to pull in sync fixes in that.
- Add appropriate locking to swap of osquery instance fields.
- Add closing of error channel so that recovery goroutine can exit.
- Remove unnecessary sync.Once.
- Remove unnecessary logging in internal_noop logger.

- Address type error introduced by #46.

method will be attempted again.

kill process group without calling getpgid (#230)

* kill process group without calling getpgid

If the original exec process is dead, then syscall.Getpgid fails and syscall.Kill is never called.
Updated the method to just call syscall.Kill directly.

fix osquery restart process (#222)

cmd.Process.Kill() only kills the child process, but not those spawned by osqueryd.
When Restart() was called, osqueryd would die, but the extension process would remain, causing
a new osqueryd process to not start again. Killing the whole process group fixes the error.

Fixed the wait_healty test helper, which was shadowing the error and terminating early.
Added errgroup.Wait() in the restart method to wait for the old osquery extension to die.

Closes #221

Occasionally during tests the 5s timeout would expire. Bumping to 10s still

unusual circumstances.

Add authenticated debug server (#187)

- Add the runtime/pprof tools as an HTTP server
- Toggle server state by sending `SIGUSR1` (default off)

- Auth token generated on startup (for security)
- Address with auth written to $launcher_root/debug_addr, and logs

Limit log writes by number of bytes (#191)

Previously, buffered log writes were limited by the total number of logs. Now
they are limited by total number of bytes, and logs that are over the max size
limit are dropped.

Make sure to cast status logs to the correct enum value. (#192)

close #189
make binary-bundle: generate distributable binaries for the launcher (#186)

Improve runtime test reliability. (#185)

Instead of waiting a predetermined time and then testing for instance health,
wait up to 30 seconds while constantly checking the health. This allows tests
to potentially run faster, and also not fail if on some runs it takes a bit
longer for the instance to become healthy.

remove old ctx references (#182)

There is only one context with 1.9.
Create root directory on startup (if it does not exist) (#184)
update report url
add link to report

allow caller to set the level of the logging middleware (#181)

Debug makes sense for a client running on host, but serverside Info is more appropriate.
By allowing the caller to make the decision we can make the logging middleware more reusable.

New make command: make xp (#178)

Build the launcher and extension on mac and linux at the same time

Osquery runtime refactoring, bugfixes and stability improvements (#176)

- Changes to public API to better reflect actual usage and ease implementation.
- Use errgroup for coordination of process management/cleanup. This helps
  prevent leaking of goroutines (relative to existing implementation).
- Fix bug in which osquery process was not restarted after failure.
- Allow logger to be set properly.
- Add logging around recovery scenarios.
- Check communication with both osquery and extension server in health check
  (previously only the extension server was checked).
- Add healthcheck on interval that initiates recovery on failure (Closes #141).
- Do not set cmd output to ioutil.Discard. Causes a bug with cmd.Wait (see
  https://github.com/golang/go/issues/20730).
move kolide_agent package from external repo here (#177)
Use dep instead of glide (#173)

Allow launcher to reconnect after MITMed TLS cert (#174)

If a TLS cert is MITMed (eg. by a captive portal), grpc will not by default
attempt to reconnect. We wrap the error handling for the TLS transport in order
to change this behavior so that our client will attempt reconnecting.

Small Updates (#449)

Update the packaging tools to remove the Control option. It is now inferred by the ControlHostname option. These are always linked, and this removes the redundancy.

Fix a log line

Generated bin-data should not include metadata, so it doesn't change every make deps invocation

Windows Update Support (#444)

On unix, we replace the old binary with the new, and then exec. Windows disallows _both_ of those steps. Instead, we can do some moves, and then exit and let the service manager restart.

See ADR and example code in tools/upgrade-exec-service-testing for technical details

user avatar table (#448)

Implements #360
Returns a base64 encoded PNG thumbnail for the user.
Not sure if it works outside the user context yet. Was easier to build first and then test.
app icons table (#447)

Rework Dockerfiles (#443)

Rework Docker to be multistage with a share build file. Add comments and makefile rules.
prepend fake serial numbers with fake (#446)

Windows is picky about characters in service names (#442)

Problem: Windows is picky about characters in service names. We often include hyphens (ie: `kolide-app`) and this causes packaging errors.

Solution: replace those with _, and then camel case it all. We use snaker elsewhere in Kolide. So, import it.

Windows Auto Updater (#441)

Fix two bugs in the windows auto updated.

First, launcher finds the TUF repository by using fmt.Sprintf("%s-tuf", binaryName). Windows has a .exe appended to binaryName. Fix is a simple TrimSuffix.

Second, in an attempt to prevent corruption, launcher would not create the local TUF repository if the directory existed. Thus, when there is a problem creating a file, the local repository in an invalid state. Launcher assumes its good (directory exists), but TUF fails hard. This drops into a error loop. This is fixed by moving the isExists check from the directory to each file in the directory.
Initial Runner should run snapshot as well as differencial (#439)

Add go-based platform info to the initial enrollment (and fix bugs) (#438)

A motley assortment of small fixes as I get this enrolling:

* Plumb build tags through make.go, to allow for fake data. Fix the version string appending.
* Add some go based platform indicators to kolide_launcher_info, as well as to the initial enrollment.
* Move kolide_launcher_info to being in both launcher, and tables.ext
* Fix error handling on the call to getEnrollDetails
* Attempt to fix suspected flakey test after #342

Work around json being unable to unmarshal errors (#437)

Adds an explicit string field for errors.
Add build tags to the version string (#436)

Merge insecureGRPC and insecureJSONRPC (#435)

Create insecureTransport as a unification of insecureGRPC and insecureJSONRPC.

Fix makefile (#433)

When the `xp-%` make rule was introduced, it broke some other targets. Rename targets to fix

Update readme with info about screensaver password (#432)

The README mentions the `screensaver_password_enabled` table, which has been broken since 10.13. 
This commit includes a link to the blog post explaining why.

Windows services and move to flag files (#415)

Now that we support flagfiles for configuration (#426) let's start using them.

* moves the launcher options into a flag file
* adds things to wix to correctly create services
* Fixes some bugs around wix template variables

Add JSON RPC implementation of the launcher server (#428)

This commit:
    * adds a new flag, `transport`, that allows launcher to specify a transport other than gRPC.
       * gRPC is the default
       * some general moving about of client instantiation etc was necessary to support this
    * adds a json rpc transport implementation of the launcher service.

Add linters (#430)

This adds, and enables, our usual stack of linters.

I also fixed the various things they came up with.

Fix windows log levels (#429)

This should set the windows service to use the info log level by default.

Also add a stack trace in to one of the exit conditions.

Rework Windows Services (#426)

We have a couple of hard to support windows corner cases. I think these stem from the difference between windows services, and traditional unix daemons. This makes them more approachable.

**Moves the windows startup process** to being explicit, instead of autodetected on whether it's in windows and non-interactive. Now there are `svc` and `svc-foreground` subcommands. This should remove a source of strange errors when interactivity is mis-detected, and also makes it easier to run launcher in various modes for debugging.

**Remove the service management** This removes the service management tools. That's better handled by the packaging.

**Change the flag parsing** from `kit/env` to `ff`. This should allow us to more easily pass in a flag file.

Travis-CI ands test updates (#423)

Some initial work to get travis-ci running. This includes updates to the make the tests more reliable, and have fewer dependancies on on the initial container setup. Travis-ci is desirable for it's multiple-platforms.

* Added travis-ci
* Updated runtime_test to download osqueryd as part of a test setup step.
* moved downloadOsqueryInBinDir to test setup and removed race conditions

This does mean that we have duplicate CI systems

Debug Enrollment errors (#425)

Replace error.New with error.Wrap

Add stacktraces to exit conditions

Fix binary-bundle (#421)

We moved a bunch of the launcher make tooling _from_ make, and into a go helper. Unfortunately, this broke the `binary-bundle` target. While not strictly required, it does help with the launcher releases.

Update the binary-bundle target to work in the new build system

Debugging and extension timeout (#417)

This commit:

* Adds an extensions_timeout to the osquery invocation
* Adds stacktraces to the top level fatal error reporting
* Adds retry logic in several places

Why?

* We occasionally see issues with osquery failing to start due to an extension timeout. This has been rare, and hard to debug. This adds retry logic and improves debugging

Log to debug, not error if GetTargets not implemented by server (#416)

This commit:
 - Checks errors returned during calls to `GetTargets`, and logs
 w/'debug' severity instead of 'error' if the error code is 
'Unimplemented'

Why?
 - There are many clients (most importantly fleet and cloud) that
 don't support this endpoint, and we can safely ignore this error in
 that case. This should reduce the number of unactionable errors that
 launcher produces when used with fleet or other servers that don't
 implement the GetTargets endpoint.

MSI refactoring (#413)

First chunk. Rework the wix interface, figure out enough wix-in-docker
for a basic test case.

add two new darwin tables from SytemPolicy framework (#410)

Adds two tables implemented in https://github.com/knightsc/system_policy
https://knight.sc/reverse%20engineering/2019/01/23/system-policy.html

osquery> select * from legacy_exec_history;
       exec_path = /Applications/zoom.us.app/Contents/MacOS/zoom.us
       mmap_path =
      signing_id = us.zoom.xos
         team_id = BJ4HAAB9B3
         cd_hash = 006905506ec2dd8b1d8bd8092a9ddadfe901ea1c
responsible_path = /Applications/zoom.us.app/Contents/MacOS/zoom.us
  developer_name = Zoom Video Communications, Inc.
       last_seen = 2018-11-30T14:41:33-05:00

  developer_name = Google, Inc.
application_name =
application_path =

       bundle_id = com.google.santa-driver
         allowed = 1
 reboot_required = 1
        modified = 0

Move systemd unit file from etc to lib (#406)

This moves the systemd unit file from being installed in /etc/systemd, to being installed in /lib/systemd. It uses the postinst script to enable and start the installed launcher.

Also fills in an prerm script that will unlink the unit file.

Fixes https://github.com/kolide/launcher/issues/405

Do we like generated data as a string (#404)

To facilitate this being linked from elsewhere, check in generated code.

And since this is xml, do it as a string, not compressed bin data.
add self clean-up to extension process. (#342)

add special build for testing in docker (#374)

In instances like docker containers, osquery will not be able to read a serial number. By using this tag we can create a unique serial for each container, which helps our ability to test server enrollments.

Initial MSI support (#401)

First pass at WiX based support for building MSI packages. It will build an MSI, but it does not yet include service definitions.

Notable non-windows changes include how package-builder selects what `targets` to build on.

Fix plist generation (#403)

We should be setting this to RunAtLoad, add that.

launchd seems to require self closing tags. This is probably
a bug from apple, but we still need to work around it. See https://github.com/groob/plist/issues/15
Fix argument check (#402)

Fix empty string in KOLIDE_LAUNCHER_UPDATE_CHANNEL (#399)

Two fixes for the empty string in KOLIDE_LAUNCHER_UPDATE_CHANNEL

First, we remove the part that always sets it in the packaging/init
scripts. This was superfluous, as it was already being set if
`p.Autoupdate && p.UpdateChannel != ""`

Second, add empty string to the case statement parsing it.

Support for upstart (#398)

Add support for upstart to packagekit.

Rework packagekit tests. Extend them to cover more of the options.

Split the render functions to have different signatures.

Add Upstart into the package-builder builds.

Rename the linux packages to `launcher-<identifier>`, and pass `conflicts`/`replaces` options to FPM

Overhaul Packing Tools (#383)

Split packaging into two sets of libraries:
* `packagekit` is generic, and lightweight wrappers around packaging tools and templates.
* `packaging` is launcher specific options.

The command line too `package-builder` has been updated to use these.

skip non-kolide packs in initial runner (#396)

adds a continue in our initial runner code that will skip running queries in packs whose names contain _kolide_

add config table (#395)

adds a table to query the config of the osquery instance

remove bad cancel (#394)

- what?
  - removes a defer call to cancel a ctx created by to the QueryTargetUpdater initializer

- why?
  - because the context is not passed into the initializer, the Actor returns and cancels its own context immediately. when reshuffling the ctx handling around in #390 i missed this in my last check

add querytarget proto + gRPC client, kolide_target_membership table (#390)

- what?
  - adds a new grpc client to receive query targeting info from the server
  - adds a new table to refer to this query targeting info
  - initializes launcher-specific tables in a new LauncherTables method
  - updates the plugin loading option func to be variadic

update go.sum for go 1.11.4 (#391)

https://github.com/golang/go/issues/29278
logs (#389)

Move make into a package (#388)

* Move make into a package
* Add some tests
* Adding some logging
Add error handling to make.go (#387)

move go build targets to make.go (#385)

Moving the build targets to make.go further simplifies the bandaids that would otherwise be necessary to create builds on both unix and windows. This particular PR was driven by the desire to have clean outputs for binary names (launcher vs launcher.exe and extension.ext vs extension.exe) but the move to Go also allowed for consistency in various build targets.

update omitempty json tags (#386)

The omitempty should be inside the quotes, not after.
replace some of the make code with Go (#384)

update runtime with windows specific helpers.  (#381)

Creates a main_windows.go which handles interactive and daemonized windows entrypoints.
Adds a mostly working implementation of a windows runtime.
set sqlite imports only on darwin files (#380)
fix date on adr (#379)

compile launcher on windows (#378)

moves all the incompatible syscalls behind build tags, but leaves them as TODOs.

refactor launcher to use the logger from kolide/kit (#377)

The kolide/kit logger implements the same functionality as the launcher logger.
It's also been updated to be compatible with windows.
use go modules.  (#376)

fix issue with duplicate log publish (#373)

updates the extension buffer logic to store a copy of the logID rather than the actual key.
when the View transaction is closed, there are no guarantees that the referenced `[]byte` key won't be written over,
which is what was happening by the time it got to the Delete call.

bypass log buffer for initial run queries. (#372)

Most of these are there to populate initial enrollment information. It makes for bad UX to wait for the logging interval.

Also snuck in a fix for when the query response returns 0 results.
log error insteado of breaking out of the loop. (#371)
make sure package builder codesigns binaries (#369)
Initial differential query (#355)

handle grpc errors (#368)

Redo the server code to correctly encode status codes around errors.
Update the client code to respect Unauthenticated as Node Invalid.
Update the logging middleware to differentiate levels when err != nil.

Option to specify the cachedir (#365)

Allow specifying the localCacheDir. This appears to have been partly implemented. I finished the plumbing
log previously masked error as debug (#364)

Add command line flag to specify output_dir (#363)

This adds a command line flag specifying the output directory. When unset, it falls back to the existing `ioutil.TempDir` behavior.
updating broken server spec link (#359)
Fix error in kolide_gdrive_sync_config table when config values are null (#361)
Log proper keyvals in new virtual table error logs (#362)

Add Google Drive sync history (#356)

This PR adds a new virtual table kolide_gdrive_sync_history which outputs the Google Drive Sync History from the Google Drive snapshot database located at: /Users/username/Library/Application Support/Google/Drive/user_default/snapshot.db

Add new table kolide_gdrive_sync_config (#351)

This PR adds a new table gdrive_sync_config which outputs the user_email and local_sync_root_path from a local device's Google Drive configuration database: /Users/username/Library/Application Support/Google/Drive/user_default/sync_config.db.

Retrieve SQLite databases from user home directory paths (#358)

Replaces the old method of determining "primary user" by querying the `last`
table. This will return more results and avoid the expensive query to the
`last` table.

Add virtual table kolide_chrome_login_keychain (#352)

Expose information about website logins via the Chrome browser.

Add 1Password Teams Configuration to kolide_email_addresses table (#353)

Retrieve potential user email addresses from the 1Password configuration.

Fix tests broken due to expired certificate (#357)

The "good" certificate used in the dialer tests had expired. Replace this with
a certificate with a very long (99999 days) validity.
Update README with Cloud trial info (#354)

implement log rotation (#350)

LaunchD does not rotate the file defined under StandardErrorPath.
Here, we render a newsyslogd config under /etc/newsyslog.d/<identifier>.conf to rotate the log once it grows past a certain size.
Upon rotation, newsyslogd will also send a SIGTERM to the launcher pid file, which will be under the launcher root directory.
Change shell logs to debug, not info (#349)

add flare binary (#344)

Adds a launcher subcommand launcher flare which builds a debug report running various tests on the system, and saving the output to a .tar.gz file which the user can then pass to support.

Currently the following tests are run:

connect to grpc server and try serveral endpoints (with a fake node key).
launch an osquery instance and connect to it with osquery-go, running a process info query.
connect to the notary server and perform a healthcheck.

Creating documentation for launcher using systemd to persistence (#346)

On Fleet docs page, there's a reference to configure the application as a service through systemd. I didn't found anything similar on launcher, then I tried this unit file on my lab, and it works as expected.
fix bug that caused the process to hang indefinitely when one of the threads should trigger a shutdown. (#345)

fix restart and shutdown options for osquery runner (#343)

Fixes a bug where the osquery runtime would not shutdown or restart correctly.
Simplified code for instantiating a runtime by providing the Shutdown and Restart functions as callbacks instead of struct fields.
update osquery-go dependency to master (#340)
Reduce shell check interval, increase error reporting (#336)
Fix opening PTY for daemon, fix error unmarshal for getShells  (#337)

Update package-builder.md (#330)

I think I've noticed twice in the past week where someone didn't have `$HOME/go/bin` in their `$PATH`. Seems like a good idea to add it to the docs?

Changing $HOME/go/bin to $GOPATH/bin and adding an additional note about how it may appear.
Add missing control flags to packaging (#331)

Add actors for individual components of launcher (#329)

This allows individual pieces of Launcher to be started and stopped with all of the other components and helps ensure the proper shutdown of started goroutines.

http client fixes (#326)

Support the disableTLS flag for GetShells requests.
Use the http.DefaultClient as default. http.DefaultClient includes a few important timeouts.
Add disable TLS flag to developer usage (#325)
Reorganize project (#324)
Add flag to disable control TLS for development (#323)

Add deadliner and multiple shells (#320)

This adds an option to timeout the webtty, and allows for multiple shell sessions

update osquery-go (#315)
check error on grpc dial (#319)

Multi Platform support for Chrome Login Keychain (#414)

Small Updates (#449)

Update the packaging tools to remove the Control option. It is now inferred by the ControlHostname option. These are always linked, and this removes the redundancy.

Fix a log line

Generated bin-data should not include metadata, so it doesn't change every make deps invocation

Windows Update Support (#444)

On unix, we replace the old binary with the new, and then exec. Windows disallows _both_ of those steps. Instead, we can do some moves, and then exit and let the service manager restart.

See ADR and example code in tools/upgrade-exec-service-testing for technical details

user avatar table (#448)

Implements #360
Returns a base64 encoded PNG thumbnail for the user.
Not sure if it works outside the user context yet. Was easier to build first and then test.
app icons table (#447)

Rework Dockerfiles (#443)

Rework Docker to be multistage with a share build file. Add comments and makefile rules.
prepend fake serial numbers with fake (#446)

Windows is picky about characters in service names (#442)

Problem: Windows is picky about characters in service names. We often include hyphens (ie: `kolide-app`) and this causes packaging errors.

Solution: replace those with _, and then camel case it all. We use snaker elsewhere in Kolide. So, import it.

Windows Auto Updater (#441)

Fix two bugs in the windows auto updated.

First, launcher finds the TUF repository by using fmt.Sprintf("%s-tuf", binaryName). Windows has a .exe appended to binaryName. Fix is a simple TrimSuffix.

Second, in an attempt to prevent corruption, launcher would not create the local TUF repository if the directory existed. Thus, when there is a problem creating a file, the local repository in an invalid state. Launcher assumes its good (directory exists), but TUF fails hard. This drops into a error loop. This is fixed by moving the isExists check from the directory to each file in the directory.

This PR adds a new virtual table kolide_gdrive_sync_history which outputs the Google Drive Sync History from the Google Drive snapshot database located at: /Users/username/Library/Application Support/Google/Drive/user_default/snapshot.db

Add new table kolide_gdrive_sync_config (#351)

This PR adds a new table gdrive_sync_config which outputs the user_email and local_sync_root_path from a local device's Google Drive configuration database: /Users/username/Library/Application Support/Google/Drive/user_default/sync_config.db.

Retrieve SQLite databases from user home directory paths (#358)

Replaces the old method of determining "primary user" by querying the `last`
table. This will return more results and avoid the expensive query to the
`last` table.

Add virtual table kolide_chrome_login_keychain (#352)

Expose information about website logins via the Chrome browser.

Add 1Password Teams Configuration to kolide_email_addresses table (#353)

Retrieve potential user email addresses from the 1Password configuration.

Fix tests broken due to expired certificate (#357)

The "good" certificate used in the dialer tests had expired. Replace this with
a certificate with a very long (99999 days) validity.
Update README with Cloud trial info (#354)

implement log rotation (#350)

LaunchD does not rotate the file defined under StandardErrorPath.
Here, we render a newsyslogd config under /etc/newsyslog.d/<identifier>.conf to rotate the log once it grows past a certain size.
Upon rotation, newsyslogd will also send a SIGTERM to the launcher pid file, which will be under the launcher root directory.
Change shell logs to debug, not info (#349)

add flare binary (#344)

Adds a launcher subcommand launcher flare which builds a debug report running various tests on the system, and saving the output to a .tar.gz file which the user can then pass to support.

Currently the following tests are run:

connect to grpc server and try serveral endpoints (with a fake node key).
launch an osquery instance and connect to it with osquery-go, running a process info query.
connect to the notary server and perform a healthcheck.

Creating documentation for launcher using systemd to persistence (#346)

On Fleet docs page, there's a reference to configure the application as a service through systemd. I didn't found anything similar on launcher, then I tried this unit file on my lab, and it works as expected.
fix bug that caused the process to hang indefinitely when one of the threads should trigger a shutdown. (#345)

fix restart and shutdown options for osquery runner (#343)

Fixes a bug where the osquery runtime would not shutdown or restart correctly.
Simplified code for instantiating a runtime by providing the Shutdown and Restart functions as callbacks instead of struct fields.
update osquery-go dependency to master (#340)
Reduce shell check interval, increase error reporting (#336)
Fix opening PTY for daemon, fix error unmarshal for getShells  (#337)

Update package-builder.md (#330)

I think I've noticed twice in the past week where someone didn't have `$HOME/go/bin` in their `$PATH`. Seems like a good idea to add it to the docs?

Changing $HOME/go/bin to $GOPATH/bin and adding an additional note about how it may appear.
Add missing control flags to packaging (#331)

Add actors for individual components of launcher (#329)

This allows individual pieces of Launcher to be started and stopped with all of the other components and helps ensure the proper shutdown of started goroutines.

http client fixes (#326)

Support the disableTLS flag for GetShells requests.
Use the http.DefaultClient as default. http.DefaultClient includes a few important timeouts.
Add disable TLS flag to developer usage (#325)
Reorganize project (#324)
Add flag to disable control TLS for development (#323)

Add deadliner and multiple shells (#320)

This adds an option to timeout the webtty, and allows for multiple shell sessions
Add "control" features (ie: remote shell) (#317)
update osquery-go (#315)
check error on grpc dial (#319)
